subject: Politics
title: Dark Money
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Dark Money.

hook.text: Dark money is political spending where the donor stays hidden. You see the ad but never know who paid.

buildup.text: Nonprofits and shell companies can spend on elections without revealing their funders to the public.

discovery.text: Dark money spending in US elections has exceeded $1 billion since 2010. It's growing every cycle.

twist.text: Both parties use dark money. Calls for transparency vanish once a party benefits from secrecy.

climax.text: Without knowing who funds political messages, voters can't judge motives or detect conflicts of interest.

punchline.text: Dark money hides who's buying influence. Democracy needs sunlight.

quiz.question: What is dark money in politics?
options: Political spending where the donor's identity is hidden
